intro: Morus inusitata, commonly known as the rare mulberry tree, is a species native to the Andaman Islands. It is a small to medium-sized tree that typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters. The plant is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves and small, aggregate fruits that are usually dark purple when mature. It thrives in moist, tropical climates and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Morus inusitata is considered a rare and endangered species.
